content: This is the same problem you posted yesterday. Thunderbird is just a messenger. It sends your request to server and then waits for a reply. You might verify with Virgin that the recommended email settings have not changed.
creator: davidsk

content: This has been happening for a few days now. When I try to download emails I get "connection to imap/virginmedia timed out" I get occasional emails coming through but not as many as I would normally expect. I've done the usual re-booting etc. Ive even deleted Thunderbird altogether (saved the profile file) and reinstalled. It first started with a message from Virgin saying that emails would be unavailable for a few hours overnight so I put it down to that. After speaking to Virgin they assure me that there is no problem in my area now. Using Virgin's web-mail all the latest emails are there but they won't come down in TB I sent a test message off my wife's tablet last night and iy showed up but nothing today, just the little dot flashing back and forth top left

content: First, I hope you backed up the profile when Thunderbird was not running. That is important. Otherwise, the profile will likely be corrupt. Second, try letting Thunderbird do the work. Try tools>import>import from another installation.
creator: davidsk

content: Try this: - settings>general scroll down to config editor and open it - search for network.protocol-handler.warn-external.http and set to true - search also for network.protocol-handler.warn-external.https and set to true - save and exit - open a link with a URL. At the popup, click 'choose' and select your preferred browser.
creator: davidsk

content:
I am aware of addons. But if you look at the addon, it has not been updated for any current versions.

This is a normal feature of replying and should be in supernova version 115 or higher verison.

It is already present when you click "forward", but why not "reply" or "reply all"
